headline.print_headline: New Math for Retirees and the 4% Rule
headline.main: New Math for Retirees and the 4% Withdrawal Rule

snippet: Though the concept has been celebrated and criticized, it has come under scrutiny again, particularly as people are now retiring during a period of low interest rates.
abstract: Twenty-year rule of thumb devised by William Bengen for withdrawing four percent annually from retirement account is under scrutiny again at time of low interest rates; retirement experts have devised more complex ways to help retirees determine what percentage of their nest egg they can safely spend each year for 30 years, without running risk of entirely running out of money.
